articles.title: The latest on the coronavirus outbreak for April 30 - CBC.ca
articles.description: The latest on the coronavirus outbreak from CBC News for Thursday, April 30.
articles.content:
Questions about outdoor COVID-19 transmission risks grow as weather improves
As millions of Canadians eye the imminent arrival of better weather and feel the effects of six weeks stuck largely at home, some are wondering whether spending more time outdoors i… [+10081 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus expert: 'We've not encountered a virus quite like this' - Yahoo Money
articles.description: For many doctors, the coronavirus and its impacts are like nothing they’ve ever seen before.
articles.content:
The coronavirus pandemic has upended normal life across the world. 
There are over 1 million cases of COVID-19 in the U.S., which is the global leader in case count. Worldwide, there are over 3 million cases. And for many doctors, the coronavirus and its imp… [+3524 chars]

articles.title: Family of N.Y.C. doctor who died by suicide says coronavirus ‘altered’ her brain - Global News
articles.description: Breen's sister says she was tormented by what she saw while trying to save COVID-19 patients.
articles.content:
The sister of Dr. Lorna Breen, who died by suicide on Sunday after treatingcoronavirus patients, is speaking out about the end of her sibling’s life.
Jennifer and Corey Feist, Breen’s sister and brother-in-law, spoke about their loss in an exclusive intervie… [+4319 chars]

articles.title: Is novel coronavirus killing more men than women? - Deccan Herald
articles.description: More men are succumbing to the coronavirus outbreak in India than women. According to the Health Ministry data, of the 1,075 COVID-19 deaths reported across the country, 65% were men, while the remaining 35% were women. For latest updates and live news on cor…
articles.content:
More men are succumbing to the coronavirus outbreak in India than women.
According to the Health Ministry data, of the 1,075 COVID-19 deaths reported across the country, 65% were men, while the remaining 35% were women.

articles.title: Lakeshore General Hospital dealing with coronavirus outbreak, regional health authority says - Global News
articles.description: The Lakeshore General Hospital is the latest in Montreal to experience an outbreak of COVID-19.
articles.content:
The Lakeshore General Hospital is the latest in Montreal to experience an outbreak of COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
The Maisonneuve-Rosemont, Santa-Cabrini and Sacré-Coeur hospitals have also experienced outbreaks of the virus in rec… [+1202 chars]

articles.title: Tiny airborne particles may carry the new coronavirus - Medical News Today
articles.description: A preliminary study from China indicates that the new coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2, may also spread through tiny airborne particles called aerosols.
articles.content: A study in Wuhan, China, detected genetic material of the new coronavirus in airborne suspensions, or aerosols, in hospitals and public spaces. The finding reinforces the importance of thorough sterilization of infection hotspots, good ventilation, and avoida… [+5805 chars]

articles.description: Peterborough Public Health for a second-straight day reports 86 confirmed cases of coronavirus in its jurisdiction.

articles.title: Misunderstood bats getting a bad rap due to coronavirus, says Winnipeg biologist - Global News
articles.description: Craig Willis, the U of W's "bat prof," says COVID-19 fears have caused people to worry unnecessarily about bats due to reports that they might be the source of the illness.
articles.content:
A University of Winnipeg biologist who runs the school’s bat lab says the flying mammals are getting a bad rap due to the coronavirus pandemic.
